subject: Re: FW: Boot Photography
preview: Hi Bonnie,  Happy Friday!  Yes, we confirm that the 360 image view can be integrated to your website.  Let us know if you have any further queries.

full_threads.body:
Hi Bonnie,

Happy Friday!

Yes, we confirm that the 360 image view can be integrated to your website.

Let us know if you have any further queries.

Hi Joy,

Thanks for checking. I understand that the 360 motion works. Can you please confirm it will be compatible with the new Lion website?

Thanks

Bonnie Sudirwan

Marketing Communications Manager





bsudirwan@mayohardware.com.au



http://www.mayohardware.com.au/



0408 331 966



Customer Service: 1300 360 211

Hi Bonnie,

Good day!

Yes, we confirm that it is working. Here's a loom video for reference:

👉Lion Compressor.spin Loom

Hi Joy,

Can you please give this a go and let me know if it works? Lion Compressor.spin

Thanks

Bonnie Sudirwan

Marketing Communications Manager





bsudirwan@mayohardware.com.au



http://www.mayohardware.com.au/



0408 331 966



Customer Service: 1300 360 211

Hi Bonnie,

I've consulted this with our team and confirming that you meant the 360 motion spins.

If yes, we believe we can accommodate this however, it is also best for us to get a sample to we can test it on the website.

Hope this helps!

action.text: Allie Borcena assigned to Joy T

From: lucas peng <lucas@productphotography.com.au>
Sent: Wednesday, 13 August 2025 10:50 AM
To: Daniel Cavasinni <dcavasinni@mayohardware.com.au>
Subject: Re: Boot Photography



360 motions usually are self-contained animated GIF files which can be used as any other still images. Drag to Spin images needed to be hosted in an external server, you get a link to put on the web page. Some web platform comes with hosting built in, you need to check with the web master.


Hope this answer your question.


Cheers







106/78A O'Riordan St

Alexandria NSW 2015
Mobile: 0433 08 22 00
Web www.productphotography.com.au

From: Chris Stojkovski
Sent: Tuesday, 29 July 2025 3:04 PM
To: lucas peng <lucas@productphotography.com.au>
Subject: RE: Boot Photography


Hi Lucas,

Please find attached a couple of briefs.

  • Borralheira: Pots examples in the brief. There is a pot that is cracked so if this can be shot on angles that doesn't show it or have it edited out.
  • Dewalt: Boots - I have put a few images on there so we can have some new angles for the shots. Important to have a shot of the new press-stud on the boots. For the workwear, please have a front and back shot on the mannequin that will help fill out the shirt (remove the mannequin from the shot when edited), and would be great to have a few close ups on the pockets as well. Hat and belt, general shots.
  • Lion:
    • The large Reflex product - Please photograph this product in and out. Have a large image of the box itself and then take out the individual product and take some shots of these as well.
    • Larger empty product box - General box photography to capture all angles
    • Inflator - There is one box with the product and one box without. Please photograph the box without the product as this is the final samples. Please then photograph the product that's in the box.
    • Note: It's important for all these boxes do not get damaged in transit. I have included a lot of bubblewrap and paper so please reuse this when packing the items back up.

If there's any questions please let me know. Feel free to send example shots if you are unsure and we can discuss.

Kind regards,

Christopher Stojkovski
Marketing Assistant

<image002.png>

Hope you are well!

We have received new Dewalt boot styles and we need to have product shots taken. Can you please let me know whens your next availability and if it will be at the new studio?

We have a total of 5 different styles at this stage and there would be more in the future. The main focus would be to make sure each boot captures the angles in the images.

Let me know if you have any questions!
